title: Central team assesses damage due to rainfall in excess in Yadgir district
content: Apart from agricultural fields, it visits the Bhima river bridge on the outskirts of Yadgir city and also, the Gursunagi Bridge-cum-Barrage

title: Freight train carrying fuel catches minor fire
content: The fire appeared to have occurred when a crow was electrocuted by the overhead electric line and fell onto the wagon when the train was approaching Thiruvananthapuram

title: Central team reviews flood damage in Kamalapur of Kalaburagi district
content: It assesses crop and infrastructure damage caused by heavy rain in August and September last year and hears grievances of farmers

title: Gandikota Festival sees heavy footfall on concluding day
content: Food kiosks offering mouth-watering local delicacies from Rayalaseema, known for its spicy palate, along with boat rides on the River Penna passing through the gorge formed between the Yerramala hills, were crowd favourites

title: Communist Party of China delegation meets RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale
content: This came a day after the CPC delegation met the senior BJP leadership here and the two organisations discussed at length the means to advance inter-party communications

title: Let's predict who will land all eight open NFL coaching jobs: Which team will hire Kevin Stefanski?
content: Could three coaches who were just fired immediately find new teams? With interviews taking place this week, we projected candidates to fill open jobs.

title: 'Best defense' steals show in Texans' wild-card win
content: The Texans' defense came into the postseason viewed as one of the league's best and showed why in their 30-6 wild-card win over Aaron Rodgers and the Steelers on Monday night.

title: Rodgers backs Tomlin: 'Absolute joke' if on hot seat
content: On Monday, as the Pittsburgh Steelers dropped a fifth straight playoff game by double digits, coach Mike Tomlin endured "Fire Tomlin" chants from fans during his team's 30-6 loss to the Houston Texans.

title: 6 questions, same Mazzulla retort: 'illegal screen'
content: Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla was asked six questions after his team's 98-96 loss to the Pacers on Monday night, and to each one, his answer was the same: "Illegal screen."

title: Falcons interview Harbaugh, who is vetting teams
content: The Falcons announced Monday that they have completed an interview with John Harbaugh for their head coaching job.

title: Koepka: 'Nervous' about return, must rebuild ties
content: Brooks Koepka will be "a little bit nervous" when he returns to the PGA Tour, and he understands he has "a lot of work to do" to rebuild his relationships with players.

title: Hurts avoids endorsement of Eagles OC Patullo
content: An endorsement of beleaguered Eagles offensive coordinator Kevin Patullo never came from Jalen Hurts on Monday, a day after last season's Super Bowl champions were knocked out of the playoffs.

title: Harden passes Shaq for 9th on all-time scoring list
content: Clippers star James Harden passed Shaquille O'Neal for ninth place on the NBA's all-time scoring list.

title: Fedorov honored, says leaving Detroit a 'mistake'
content: Sergei Fedorov said leaving the Red Wings was "a huge mistake" as the franchise retired his jersey Monday night.

content: Let's preview the divisional round matchups. How can each team win next weekend and advance? Here's what to know.

content: Potential offensive changes for the Eagles? Let's size up why five playoff teams are heading home early.

content: Which new names enter Jeremy Woo's updated 2026 NBA mock draft and who slid into the top 30 picks or out of the first round?

title: Men's: Can new No. 1 overall Arizona (finally) get over the hump?
content: The Wildcats are always there, always very good, yet somehow leave you wanting more. This could be the year that changes.

title: Women's: First loss drops Texas off top line? Not so fast
content: A five-point defeat at LSU doesn't erase the Longhorns' five Quadrant 1 wins. The SEC has seven teams (!) in the top 16.

title: How Miami offensive coordinator Shannon Dawson emerged from nowhere
content: The architect of the Hurricane offense began his career grinding for a job at Southeastern Louisiana.

title: Our midwinter progress report for all 30 MLB clubs
content: With a lot of work still left to do, here's how the 2026 win projections and playoff odds stand today.

title: What would a Russian Olympic hockey team look like in 2026?
content: The Games will be missing one of the sport's top countries. Here's what the group could have looked like had it been competing.

title: Are blockbuster NBA trades actually worth it? We evaluated 14 big deals since 2013
content: As teams shy away from dealing first-rounders, which trades have been the biggest successes and utter failures?

title: Predicting the Premier League table: How will all 20 teams finish the season?
content: Who will win the Premier League and who will be relegated? It's time to predict how the second half of the season finishes.

title: Why Alonso successor Arbeloa will bring a bit of Mourinho back to Real Madrid
content: Álvaro Arbeloa, Xabi Alonso's successor as Real Madrid coach, was a 'Mourinhista' as a player and has adopted his former boss's mentality and approach.

title: Answering the biggest questions regarding Brooks Koepka's return to the PGA Tour
content: How will LIV Golf react? Will other LIV Golf stars follow Koepka back to the PGA Tour? How much will golf fans see Koepka on the PGA Tour this season?

content: What are the biggest challenges to UConn's hopes of a repeat? Which players should earn All-America honors?

title: NFL divisional round odds, early bets: Seahawks favored vs. 49ers; Rams over Bears
content: Our early bets for the NFL divisional round, plus spreads, lines, totals and FPI analysis for every game.

title: Seven reasons why the Bears are the NFL's comeback kings
content: Saturday's wild-card win over the Packers was the seventh time the Bears overcame a fourth-quarter deficit.

title: NASCAR goes back in time by restoring Chase format
content: NASCAR's convoluted Playoff format confused most everyone, so on Monday, it announced it was bringing back the postseason formula from 2004-13.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Rúben Neves as Carrick's first signing
content: A move for Al Hilal midfielder Rúben Neves is being lined up by Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Dalton Smith's title win shakes up junior welterweight
content: The crowning of a new WBC champion forces major changes in the 140-pound division. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: McConnell, Watson, Nurkic among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Three arrested in Kalaburagi for trying to throw prohibited items into Central Prison
content: Prison constable notices the three men trying to throw prohibited articles onto the jail premises and raises an alarm

title: Fuel outlet bomb blast accused among three arrested in Manipur
content: The three belong to extremist groups, the Kanglei Yawol Kanna Lup and the People’s Revolutionary Party of Kangleipak

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026 | State school festival,  the Olympics of arts, from January 14
content: The 64th edition of the school arts festival,  being held in the cultural capital of Kerala, indeed promises plenty. Nearly 14,000 students will showcase their talent in 249 events

title: Indrakeeladri to host Sankranti celebrations with ‘Bommala Koluvu’, cultural events
content: As part of the celebrations, traditional Bhogi bonfires will be lit in a ceremonial manner on January 14 at 5 a.m. near Sri Mahaganapati Swamy temple

title: CM Stalin releases Tamil Nadu  Circular Economy Policy and  Warehousing Policy
content: The Circular Economy Policy provides for a special package of incentives for recycling facilities and technology enablers/platform entities. The Warehousing Policy provides for incentives to stakeholders, including market participants, operators, and developers

title: Karnataka Budget in first week of March and preparations on, says Siddaramaiah
content: Sadhana Samavesha to be held in Haveri ahead of Budget, likely on Feb 13; Siddaramaiah says he and DKS had no discussions with Rahul Gandhi

title: Efforts to introduce Sangolli Rayanna to the nation seeing success: MLA
content: Mahantesh Koujalgi was speaking after inaugurating the Sangolli Utsav in Sangolli of Belagavi district

title: Kerala Kalolsavam 2026: Thrissur all set for a vibrant school fest reminiscent of Pooram
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan will inaugurate the 64th Kerala State School Arts Festival. The Exhibition Ground at Thekkinkadu Maidan is the main venue.

title: A.P. govt. removes Additional Retail Excise Tax on bars
content: Decision taken following a recommendation by a GoM constituted in August 2024 to come up with a new, comprehensive excise policy

title: UDF walks a tightrope as KC(M) return buzz rattles central Travancore
content: Congress appears wary of opening a Pandora’s box in central Travancore, where any seat-sharing exercise will require balancing the competing claims of rival Kerala Congress factions

title: Khadi flag awareness campaign launched in Hubballi
content: A group of like-minded people in collaboration with KKGSS has taken it up to protect BIS-approved national flag-making units

title: Telangana speeds up inter-caste marriage incentive clearances; ₹15 crore released in December
content: Initiative is part of a broader social reform agenda aimed at combating caste-based discrimination; eligible couples are offered ₹2.5 lakh under the scheme

title: Thrissur traders revive night-time shopping to add zest to School Arts Festival
content: The Thrissur Chamber of Commerce and the district’s Vyapari Vyavasayi Ekopana Samithi unit have jointly called on the traders to keep their shops open till 10 p.m.

title: BESCOM rolls out single-window portal for EV charging, battery-swapping stations
content: The portal is designed to speed up rollout of EV infrastructure by simplifying land identification and electricity connectivity

title: A lifetime of teaching tribal children without any job security
content: In the remote Edamalakkudy tribal panchayat, Vijayalakshmi has kept primary education alive for nearly three decades on a meagre salary.

title: Raise questions about injustice suffered by North Karnataka under successive govts, says MLA
content: Asif (Raju) Sait was speaking at an event organised by Belagavi Journalists Association members to felicitate journalists

title: SIT to probe defamatory content targeting woman IAS officer
content: The team will function under the supervision of Hyderabad Police Commissioner V.C. Sajjanar and is headed by Joint Commissioner of Police (North Range) N. Swetha

title: NDA governments farmer-friendly, says Health Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav lays foundation stone for the construction of new “Vahana Mandapam” at the Sri Lakshmi Chennakesava Swamy temple in Dharmavaram town of Sri Sathya Sai district

title: Bengaluru police crackdown on illegal immigrants, detain 15; landlords demolish structures
content: The Hebbagodi police have registered five FIRs and conducted door-to-door verification using mobile-based identification methods. They have also booked landlords who allegedly rented out land and allowed the construction of sheds and houses for migrant labourers engaged in garbage segregation.

title: We act openly, no secret MoU: BJP hits back after Congress questions Chinese delegation's visit
content: The Congress media and publicity department head, Pawan Khera, said his party demands full accountability and complete transparency from the government on its China policy

title: Chennai Sangamam to feature fashion show by folk artistes sporting Co-optex products
content: Speaking to reporters, DMK Parliamentary Party leader Kanimozhi, who is instrumental in organising the festival, said that over 30 artistes would take part in the fashion show

title: Maharashtra zilla parishad, panchayat samiti polls to be held on February 5
content: The schedule was announced a day after the Supreme Court extended the January 31 timeline for completing the poll process for local body elections by two weeks

title: Zero tolerance for sexual misconduct: NRAI Chief on case involving national coach
content: Law enforcement agencies are investigating the alleged sexual assault of a minor shooter by national coach Ankush Bhardwaj

title: Air India facing UK lawsuit from estates of some deceased in 2025 plane crash
content: The Ahmedabad-London Air India flight, a Boeing 787 Dreamliner with ​242 people on ⁠board, lost height seconds after taking off from Ahmedabad on June 12, 2025 ‌and erupted in a fireball as it hit a ‍medical college hostel

title: Accident leads to rescue of ‘kidnapped’ children in Dharwad; accused had a POCSO case against him in 2018
content: The accident at Joida in Uttara Kannada district helped in the miraculous rescue of two children who were allegedly kidnapped by the accused on a motorcyclist from a Dharwad government school.

title: 'Take over your institutions': Trump tells Iran protesters 'help is on its way'; invokes 'MIGA'
content: Former President Donald Trump urged Iranian protestors to continue their demonstrations and seize institutions, promising aid was en route.  He declared he had cancelled all meetings with Iranian officials until the "senseless killing of protesters" ceases, hinting at a "Make Iran Great Again" sentiment. Trump vowed accountability for those involved in the violence.

title: Maharashtra civic body polls: Campaigning ends, SEC enforces MCC — all you need to know
content: Maharashtra gears up for its local body elections, with the State Election Commission announcing the schedule for Zilla Parishad and Panchayat Samiti polls. Voting is set for February 5th, following a Supreme Court-mandated deadline extension. Key dates for nominations, scrutiny, and withdrawals have been released, with counting on February 7th. Special arrangements will ensure accessibility for all voters.

title: Kohli set to surpass Sachin, Dravid, Rohit, Rahane; closes in on historic feat
content: Virat Kohli is on the cusp of a new Indian record, aiming for his sixth consecutive ODI fifty-plus score against New Zealand in Rajkot. This remarkable streak places him alongside legends like Tendulkar and Dravid.  With an exceptional recent run, Kohli's form is a major talking point as India seeks to extend their series lead.

title: 'Pay your own way': Trump's message to 'big tech; Microsoft first to commit to lower power bills
content: US President Donald Trump has announced Microsoft will implement significant changes this week to prevent American households from bearing the cost of AI data centers' high energy consumption. He emphasized that tech giants must "pay their own way." This comes as rising utility bills are linked to AI infrastructure's massive power demands, with some states seeing substantial price hikes.

title: India’s US education boom: How America is cutting off its own talent feed
content: India’s US education boom has been built on a quiet assumption that OPT will give graduates time to work, earn, and attempt longer-term visas. Now that bridge is being recast in Washington as a loophole followed by proposals that could cut, tax, or time-limit the post-study runway. For Indian students and families, the risk is obvious: Degree stays costly, but the payoff window shrinks.

title: Controversy! Amid Olympic 2036 dreams, Dane blasts India Open conditions - 'Unhealthy'
content: Denmark’s Mia Blichfeldt again criticised playing conditions at the India Open, saying the move to Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium has not helped. She described the venue as cold, dirty and unhealthy, making warm-up difficult, and urged organisers and the BWF to intervene ahead of the World Championships. Canada’s Michelle Li and former world champion Ratchanok Intanon also raised concerns over the cold conditions.

title: Early Deals: Amazon India launches discounts on top brands; sale starts Jan 16
content: Amazon India's Great Republic Day Sale kicks off January 16th, offering massive discounts on smartphones, electronics, and home appliances. Early deals are live now, featuring popular brands like Apple, Samsung, and OnePlus. Shoppers can also find savings on laptops, TVs, audio gear, and kitchen appliances, with additional bank offers and EMI options available.

title: Precious metals surge: Silver jumps Rs 6,000 to lifetime high; gold hits fresh record
content: Silver prices have reached an unprecedented Rs 2,71,000 per kilogram in Delhi, while gold hit a new high of Rs 1,45,000 per 10 grams. This surge, driven by safe-haven demand amidst global geopolitical tensions, marks significant gains for both precious metals. Investors are now keenly awaiting US inflation data for future market direction.

title: Tragic! Olympic medalist dies in avalanche; won bronze in snowboarding
content: Swiss snowboarding pioneer Ueli Kestenholz, a bronze medalist at the sport's Olympic debut in 1998, has tragically passed away at 50 after being caught in an avalanche. Kestenholz, who also excelled in X-Games, was snowboarding with a friend in the Valais region when the incident occurred. He was later airlifted to hospital.

title: AI doomer narrative criticised: Nvidia CEO says negativity is harmful; questions motive
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has strongly criticized the "doomer narrative" surrounding AI, arguing that influential figures spreading fear are causing significant harm. He believes this negativity discourages vital investments in AI development, hindering its potential to become safer and more beneficial for society. Huang also voiced concerns about companies seeking government regulation for their own gain.

title: US sanctions on Iran to have minimal impact on India, say govt sources - here’s why
content: India anticipates minimal impact from US tariffs on Iran trade, with government sources highlighting limited exposure.  Exporters confirm compliance with US norms for humanitarian trade, primarily food and pharmaceuticals, suggesting no adverse effects.  However, currency depreciation poses a greater concern for Indian businesses.

title: WEF 2026: Trump to attend with the largest-ever US delegation; strong Indian side also expected
content: US President Donald Trump will lead a large delegation to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, starting January 18. Global leaders will convene amidst rising geopolitical tensions and economic uncertainty, with a focus on Ukraine, Gaza, and Latin America. India will also have a significant presence with ministers and over 100 CEOs.

title: Budget 2026: Will old income tax regime be discontinued leaving new regime as the only option?
content: Budget 2026 income tax expectations: Will the old income tax regime be eventually phased out by the government? With increasing push for the new income tax regime, and higher adoption, we ask experts if the old regime be discontinued:

title: Kohli vs Sachin: The ‘nervous’ 90s and the great ‘What If’
content: Virat Kohli is in exceptional form, achieving six consecutive fifty-plus scores, including two centuries. This remarkable run brings his international century tally to 84, just 16 shy of Sachin Tendulkar's record. A recent 93 against New Zealand highlights his consistent performance, fueling speculation about his potential if 'nervous' nineties were converted.

title: 'Google has hired tons of people without college degrees,' says Sergey Brin: Here’s why
content: Elite universities like Stanford once guaranteed top-tier opportunities, but this is changing. Companies, including Google, are now prioritizing skills over degrees, recognizing talent beyond formal education. This shift signals a reevaluation of what credentials truly represent in the evolving job market, prompting universities to reconsider their role.

title: 'BJP-EC nexus': Mamata says poll body deleted 54 lakh 'genuine voters', plan to remove 1 cr more
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee accused the Election Commission of unilaterally deleting 54 lakh names from draft electoral rolls, alleging a BJP-EC nexus. She claimed genuine voters, including women who changed surnames, were removed without notice, possibly using AI tools. Banerjee further alleged plans to remove another crore names and accused the EC of restricting booth-level agents.

title: Relief for gig workers: Blinkit drops ‘10-minute’ delivery claim; Zepto, Swiggy may follow
content: Quick commerce platform Blinkit has removed its "10-minute delivery" claim, shifting to "30,000+ products delivered at your doorstep." This move follows government discussions aimed at improving gig worker safety and welfare, with other platforms expected to follow suit. The change comes after worker protests against the pressure of ultra-fast delivery models.

title: Rial Collapse Protests: Iran faces largest unrest in decades; over 2,000 killed, 10,000 arrested
content: Iran faces widespread unrest fueled by economic collapse, not ideology. The rial's sharp decline triggered strikes and protests across all provinces, impacting ordinary citizens and the middle class. This broad-based challenge, marked by significant deaths and arrests, strikes at the regime's core ability to provide economic survival, making it a critical juncture for the Islamic Republic.

title: Rapper Top5 accuses 76ers’ Andre Drummond of serious misconduct claims
content: Philadelphia 76ers center Andre Drummond faces controversy after Canadian rapper Top5 accused him of infidelity while the rapper was imprisoned. Despite the baseless allegations gaining traction online, Drummond remains focused on basketball, having recently overcome a knee injury. Fans on social media have reacted with a mix of disbelief and criticism towards the rapper's claims.

title: 'Take them to your house': SC questions those feeding stray dogs; compensation warning for states
content: The Supreme Court warned states of heavy compensation for inaction on stray dog bites, particularly affecting children and the elderly. The bench also demanded accountability from dog feeders, suggesting they house the animals. The court emphasized its focus on Animal Birth Control rules and flagged non-compliance by civic bodies, leading to deaths from bites and accidents.

title: Russian oil trade: India slips to third-largest buyer in December
content: India has slipped to third place in Russian fossil fuel imports for December 2025, with Reliance Industries and state refiners significantly cutting crude oil purchases. Turkiye now ranks second, while China remains the top buyer. This shift follows new US sanctions on Russian oil producers, impacting India's previously high reliance on discounted Russian crude.

title: Makar Sankranti 2026 50 wishes, messages to share with your loved ones
content: Makar Sankranti, a solar calendar festival, marks the Sun's northward journey, symbolizing change, warmth, and new beginnings. Celebrated across India with various names, it fosters joy and gratitude. The article offers a collection of wishes, messages, and quotes to share, strengthening bonds and spreading positivity during this auspicious occasion.

title: Mustafizur row: 'Position unchanged' on India travel, B'desh tells ICC; repeats 'security concerns'
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board reaffirmd its stance against traveling to India for the T20 World Cup 2026 due to security concerns, requesting matches be moved. The ICC has rejected these claims, urging Bangladesh to reconsider, but the BCB's position remains unchanged. Discussions are ongoing to find a resolution.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in Delhi, Pune & other cities - Check rates
content: Gold prices stayed in focus as MCX futures hit fresh highs amid strong global cues, pushing local rates higher across major cities. With volatility persisting, buyers and investors are watching closely. Check today’s gold prices in your city before making a purchase or trade.

title: Disguised as civilian plane: Anti-drug strike raises ques — did Trump commit a war crime?
content: A secret US military aircraft, disguised as a civilian plane, reportedly killed 11 people in a drug-smuggling boat attack. Officials suggest this tactic, if it tricked victims into believing it was harmless, could constitute a war crime under international law. The Pentagon maintains its operations comply with conflict laws.

title: Antonio Brown erupts online after DK Metcalf’s costly blunder vs Texans
content: In a low-stress first half, the Steelers held a narrow 7-6 lead over the Texans. Early drops by DK Metcalf, including one on a crucial drive, drew criticism, amplified by former Steeler Antonio Brown's social media commentary. Despite offensive struggles, Pittsburgh aimed to overcome early miscues in the second half.

title: ICE criticism, Iran silence: How Golden Globes exposed Hollywood's hypocrisy
content: Golden Globe attendees wore anti-ICE pins to protest the recent killing of Renee Good by an ICE officer. This political statement contrasted with last year's ceremony, highlighting ongoing protests and calls for accountability. The article questions Hollywood's silence on the protests in Iran, suggesting reasons like "Trump Derangement System" and the complexity of the Iranian narrative.

title: J&K: Security forces launch search operations in Kathua; gunshots heard
content: Security forces engaged in a search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district after spotting suspected terrorist movement. Gunshots were heard in the Najote forest area as militants fired upon noticing the advancing troops. The operation has been intensified to track down the ultras, with heightened anti-terrorist activities across the region ahead of Republic Day.

title: How to look busy without working hard, asks employee: Why corporate culture loves pretence
content: Many workplaces judge employees on appearance rather than results. Taking paid leave can be seen as a risk, leading to presenteeism where employees are visible but not productive. This culture of appearing busy, instead of doing real work, costs companies billions in lost productivity and fuels employee burnout. True productivity thrives on trust and fair evaluation of output.

title: Mary Kom vs Onler Karong divorce : Onler alleges affairs; Mary claims property theft
content: Mary Kom's estranged husband, Karung Onkholer, denies her allegations of financial misappropriation and land loss, calling them baseless. He counters by accusing the boxer of extramarital affairs, claiming their marriage deteriorated over a decade ago. Kom, meanwhile, describes the separation as the "darkest phase" of her life, alleging she was cheated of crores and lost land.

title: Gig workers row: No more 10-minute delivery deadline; Centre urges quick commerce players to drop time limit
content: Quick commerce platforms have agreed to remove '10-minute delivery' services after Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya intervened, prioritizing the safety of delivery partners. Companies assured the government they would cease advertising strict delivery time limits, with Blinkit already removing the promise from its branding.

title: Making Star Trek real: Hegseth, Musk to unleash AI for US military
content: At Starbase, Hegseth laid out a concrete plan. Elon Musk’s Grok AI model and Google’s Gemini will be deployed across both classified and unclassified Pentagon networks. These systems will not sit on the sidelines. They will operate inside the military’s digital backbone.

title: Bishnoi gang strikes again in Canada: Jasvir Desi’s Brampton home sprayed with bullets
content: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's Canada-based chief, Goldy Dhillon, claimed responsibility for a shooting at businessman Jasvir Desi's Brampton home. Dhillon alleged Desi supported rival groups and warned of similar consequences for opponents. This follows previous gang-linked violence in Canada, including an attack on Kapil Sharma's café.

title: Kranti Gaud Exclusive: World Cup glory, father's honour and a Hardik Pandya dream
content: Kranti Gaud, a World Cup-winning cricketer from Ghuwara village, has become a local hero. Her historic victory led to her father's job reinstatement after 13 years. Gaud, inspired by Hardik Pandya, aims to perform well for UP Warriorz in the WPL and believes her success is changing perceptions about girls in sports.

title: There Were 16 'Passengers' On Failed PSLV Mission, Only 'KID' Survived
content: Sometimes, what it takes to get the job done is a child-like tenacity. And 'KID', one of the 'passengers' aboard Monday's failed PSLV-C62 mission, appears to have displayed exactly that.

title: World Stocks Diverge As Iran Worries Push Up Oil Price
content: European and Asian stock markets diverged on Tuesday as investors awaited key US inflation data, while concerns about Iran lifted oil prices.

title: Bhopal Literature Fest Cancels Session On Babur Amid Fear Of Protest
content: The Bhopal Literature and Art Festival found itself at the centre of a controversy after a scheduled session on the book Babur - The Quest for Hindustan was cancelled at the last minute.

title: Danish, Greenlandic Envoys To Meet Vance, Rubio Tomorrow
content: Denmark's foreign minister said Tuesday that he and his Greenlandic counterpart would meet with US Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio at the White House on Wednesday.

title: BJP, AAP Trade Blows In Escalating Poster War Over Guru Teg Bahadur Row
content: The political confrontation over the alleged remarks during a Delhi Assembly debate on Guru Teg Bahadur's sacrifice has sharply escalated, spilling out of the House and onto the streets, and now on social media.

title: "Frivolous": Top Court Rejects Plea On Removing Savarkar Portraits From Parliament
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to entertain a PIL seeking the removal of portraits of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar from Parliament and other public spaces, warning the petitioner of exemplary costs before allowing the plea to be withdrawn.

title: 22-Minute Strike On Terrorists Shook Pakistan's Decision-Making: Army Chief
content: Indian Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi on Tuesday said that there were two turning points during Operation Sindoor, one of them being the very 22-minute strike on terror targets due to which the decision-making of Pakistan was disrupted.

title: '2 Terror Camps Near Border, 6 Across LoC Still Active': Army Chief
content: Indian Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi said that eight terror camps, of which two are near the International Border (IB), and six across the Line of Control (LoC), are still active, and security forces are keeping a close watch on them.

title: "Markets Will Determine Prices": RBI Governor To NDTV On Falling Rupee
content: The Rupee slipping past the Rs 90 per dollar mark has been a psychological shock on the people, but Sanjay Malhotra -- who replaced Shaktikanta Das recently as the Governor of the Reserve Bank of India -- said it was a part of normal fluctuations.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Art Of The Deal: As Trump Wavers, India Is Writing Its EU Playbook
content: As Europe leans in and US policy stays volatile, New Delhi is building a portfolio of pacts to secure markets, capital, and supply chains.

title: Manipur's Naga Tribes Allege Threat By Kuki Insurgents, Block Village Road
content: The ZUF (S Kamson) alleged they were fired upon by Kuki insurgents while its members were busy destroying poppy farms. The gunfight led to tension in nearby villages, they said.

title: Republican Congressman Files Bill To Annex Greenland
content: A Republican congressman from Florida introduced a bill Monday to annex Greenland and make it the 51st US state as President Donald Trump threatens to seize the autonomous Danish territory.

title: Bangladesh Summons Myanmar Ambassador Amid Surge In Clashes Along Border
content: After tension along the Myanmar-Bangladesh border, Bangladesh has summoned Myanmar's Ambassador to Dhaka, Kyaw Soe Moe.

title: After Summons, Bhagwant Mann, Akal Takht Face Off Over Time Of Appearance
content: A fresh flashpoint has emerged between Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann and Sri Akal Takht Sahib, the highest temporal seat of Sikhs, over the timing of the chief minister's appearance before the clergy for his alleged "anti-Sikh" statements.

title: China Provokes India With 'Shaksgam Valley' Claim: Dispute Explained
content: China has once again reignited tensions with India by reiterating its unfounded cartographical claims over Jammu and Kashmir's Shaksgam Valley, stressing that the Chinese infrastructure projects in the area are "beyond reproach".

title: "Catastrophic": Qatar Warns Of Region-Wide War As Trump Weighs Iran Strikes
content: A military escalation between the United States and Iran would have grave consequences for the region, Qatar said Tuesday after Washington threatened strikes in response to a government crackdown on protests in the Islamic republic.

title: Delhi Court To Re-Examine Probe Agency's Plea Against Arvind Kejriwal's Bail
content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday listed for hearing on May 8 the Enforcement Directorate's plea against the bail granted by a trial court to former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy-linked money laundering case.

title: "We Have Won": Raghav Chadha On Centre's Direction To Halt 10-Minute Deliveries
content: Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha welcomed the Centre's direction to halt 10-minute deliveries, scoring a big win for gig workers who have been protesting work and pay conditions.

title: Burned Buildings, Smashed ATMs: Iranians Describe Chaos In First Calls Abroad
content: Iranians made phone calls abroad for the first time in days Tuesday after authorities severed communications during a crackdown on nationwide protests that activists say killed at least 646 people.

title: BMRCL floats tenders for Bengaluru metro’s Phase 3 civic works
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Orioles to debut Tupac Shakur bobblehead against Athletics
content: a prominent figure on the west coast rap scene, the legendary rapper moved to Baltimore from the Bronx in 1985 . he went to middle school and high school in Baltimore before moving to Marin City, Calif. in 1988 . on may 8th, we're celebrating the life and legacy of legendary rapper and actor Tupac Shakur .

title: Midterm review: Who are the standout stars in Europe's major women's leagues?
content: 'fox-in-the-box' Schüller is a perfect transfer for man united . the 25-year-old german winger has been the biggest beneficiary of José Barcala's new system at Bayern and has been a creative behemoth .

title: Live updates on Supreme Court transgender athlete cases
content: The transgender athlete debate has come to the nation's highest court. On Tuesday, for the first time, the U.S. Supreme Court will hear oral arguments on whether transgender girls and women should be eligible for girls' and women's sports. The court will hear two cases. First up is Little v. Hecox, a case rooted in Idaho, which passed the first law restricting transgender girls and women in sports in 2020. In the afternoon, the court will hear arguments in West Virginia v. B.P.J., a case that involves a transgender girl named Becky Pepper-Jackson who competes in track and cross country at her high school. ESPN reporters Katie Barnes and Shwetha Surendran will have live coverage, from inside and outside the courtroom, all day.

title: Niners defeat defending champs for NFC wild-card win
content: the 49ers won 12 games despite playing most of the season without defensive end and linebacker . they had withstood the repeated injuries to some of their brightest stars . despite that devastating injury to another team leader and captain, they continued to battle .

title: Can breakout star Leo Carlsson get the Ducks back on track?
content: leo Carlsson's goal in the shootout proves to be the difference for the Ducks . the 21-year-old forward was sitting second in league scoring with 10 goals and 25 points . he's got two goals and six points in his past 15 games . his most recent marker is in Anaheim's 5-3-1 win over the pennsylvania .

title: Alonso wasn't perfect, but sacking him ignores Madrid's real problems
content: Xabi Alonso becomes the tenth permanent manager of a 21-plus-year presidential reign . the 44-year-old leaves with real madrid only four points off the top of laLiga . lvaro Carreras and Ral Asencio each had point-blank chances to score .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks remain Super Bowl favorites; Patriots now AFC front-runner
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams , who advanced to the divisional round with a win on Saturday.  The  New England Patriots  and  Buffalo Bills  are now the top two favorites in the AFC after advancing to the Divisional round on Sunday. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the fifth-best odds to win the Super Bowl despite being the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, had a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: UK student politely corrects ‘Sanatan Dharma’ pronunciation, wins praise online
content: video shows an interaction in a class where the teacher discusses "Sanatan Dharma" but gets the pronunciation incorrect . the video has since gone viral, and the student politely corrects the pronunciation of the word . this comes at a time when the world seems to be polarised .

title: The resurgence of Vance Joseph: How former Broncos head coach has keyed the defense
content: Denver Broncos defensive coordinator Vance Joseph was 38 years old . his résumé includes coordinator gigs with the Miami Dolphins and the Arizona Cardinals . he had just completed six years as a defensive backs coach with the Texans .

title: Texans dominate Steelers, Aaron Rodgers in wild-card matchup
content: the Texans beat the Pittsburgh Steelers 30-6 in the wild-card round of the playoffs . the texans' defense held the Steelers to 175 yards, scored two touchdowns and harassed future quarterback Aaron Rodgers in a playoff game just once in 21 prior starts . a 13-10 loss to the San Francisco 49ers was the signal-caller's last playoff game with Green Bay .

title: State of the AL East: What's next for Yankees, Red Sox, Jays, Rays and O's
content: the defending AL champions have invested the most money in free agency this winter . the Boston Red Sox are the only MLB club yet to sign a free agent to a major league contract . however, the Baltimore Orioles have made significant trades to improve their roster .

title: CFP National Title first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: ‘Death to dictatorship’: A tale of two revolutions - How Iran is back where it started
content: protests have erupted from the bazaars and universities, driven initially by a collapsing currency, soaring prices and daily economic desperation . anger over livelihoods has quickly spilled into something deeper: open defiance of the political order itself.

title: Sankranti, Lohri, Bihu and beyond: Tracing the harvest celebrations of India
content: mid-January marks the easing of winter, the completion of harvest cycles, and the promise of longer days ahead . it is also among the earliest major festival periods of the year, arriving with near-universal observance but strikingly different expressions . the dates are broadly shared across the nation, but each state and region interprets the season through its own rituals and memories .

title: Isro's failed PSLV-C62 mission: Spanish satellite survives, transmits data for over 3 minutes
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ.
